item.title: Mini-Review: Trustworthy Systems Thinking
item.description:
Unpacking the layer of reasoning dedicated to designing and maintaining trustworthy systems.

This mini-review isolates Trustworthy Systems Thinking as a distinct reasoning layer because trust is not just an output of good engineering ‚Äî it is a first-class design constraint.

Without explicitly engineering for trust:

  • Architectural integrity weakens.
  • Decision-making loses grounding.
  • System evolution becomes chaotic.

üìç Critical Insight: Trust is a design constraint, not a late-stage evaluation.
